article.title: Paper Impermanence as a Consequence of pH and Storage Conditions
article.author: Smith, R.D.
article.text: This article aims to provide some basic information, references to further information, and a sense of proportion about the action of hydrogen ions and storage conditions on paper. Other important causes of paper deterioration, such as oxidative degradation, biological attack, photocatalyzed degradation, and mechanical wear and tear, will not be considered at this time.
